Description: A more advanced radar decoy which features an active component, enabling it to seduce chaff-discriminant and anti-radiation missiles by emitting its own radar signals which mimic those of ship-based radars. The EA99 decoy requires a known missile threat in order to determine its optimal fly-out direction to maximize probability of seduction. These decoys cannot be dumb-fired like chaff and flares. Size: 1 Cruise Speed: 20 m/s Range: 600 m Decoy Capabilities: Signatures: - RADAR - PSV RADAR Requires Target: Yes TTGI Autofire: 15 Refire Time: 20 Codename "Conure", I can't tell you much about these, most of their system are classified and I only know basic operation when I have to service them. They have a small propellant charge in the base and an impressively complex radar emitter in that fuselage. Once it activates, it'll steer away from the ship and deploy its emitter bars. Just a heads up, though, these have an insane amount of signature output and you can bet once it's used, anything in the Battlespace will be able to see it. - I. Parker, CMC
